intro: Acrodiclidium macrophyllum, commonly known as the giant spurge, is a striking plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, fleshy, green leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, branched clusters, which bloom in late spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Its latex is toxic and can cause skin irritation, making it a plant to handle with care.
